[Know that the following factors are suggestive of maltreatment: fracture before the age of walking, unexplained context or unclear context; delay in the child's presentation; metaphyseal or torsional location; presence of ecchymosis, petechiae or haematomas, especially of different ages (how long ago); radiological discovery of trauma of different ages (how long ago), of unusual location (scapula, sternum, etc.), of frequent but unusual location (shoulder blade, sternum, etc.), of frequent but unusual location (shoulder blade, sternum, etc.).Several different types of trauma (burns, wounds, haematomas or ecchymoses, fractures, cranial trauma, etc.) of different ages (how long ago they occurred).

question.title: What is suggestive of maltreatment in a child with a fracture?
question.description: A child presents with a fracture. What signs should lead to suspicion of maltreatment?

option_a.title: Fracture after the age of walking
option_a.description: A fracture that occurs after the child has started walking

option_b.title: Unexplained context or unclear context
option_b.description: A situation where the context of the fracture is unclear or unexplained

option_c.title: Presence of ecchymosis, petechiae or haematomas of the same age
option_c.description: Multiple injuries of the same age

option_d.title: Radiological discovery of trauma of the same location

correct_option.title: Unexplained context or unclear context
correct_option.description: A situation where the context of the fracture is unclear or unexplained
